Content.Text:
<FACE_TORCU><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Good morning, <MYNAME>. You're certainly up
early! Shows you've got spirit.

<FACE_TORCU><POS_RIGHT><FACE_LAUGH>
I'm the kind of person who likes to study in the
early morning. If you start your day with some
studying, you start the day fresh!

<FACE_TORCU><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Why does the sun rise? And why does it set? I
wish to learn all the details. Perhaps I should do
some research...

<FACE_TORCU><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Hello, <MYNAME>. How's your work going?
<PAGE>
Output is crucial, to be sure, but it's always
important to think about efficiency as well.
Never forget that! And never surrender!

<FACE_TORCU><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Hello, <MYNAME>.
<PAGE>
Hmmm? What's wrong? Do I have something on
my face?

<FACE_TORCU><POS_RIGHT><FACE_LAUGH>
Pepita is the one who cooks for all of us.
<PAGE>
I was watching her make us food today and saw
first-hand just how efficient she is. She makes
me proud to be a Nature Sprite!

<FACE_TORCU><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Good evening. It's a bit late, isn't it? I'd suggest
getting to bed earlier than this when possible.
It's bad for your health otherwise.

<FACE_TORCU><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
I wonder how those who burn the midnight oil
conduct themselves early in the morning. How
do they handle the lack of sleep?
<PAGE>
<FACE_ANGRY>...What? They sleep in?! Well, that's simply
inefficient! How disappointing...

<FACE_TORCU><POS_RIGHT><FACE_SAD>
When the sun sets and the moon rises, my eyes
always become heavy. Do the moon's beams
conceal some sort of sleepiness ray?

<FACE_TORCU><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Spring is a bountiful season for all life on Earth.
And that includes us.
<PAGE>
Perhaps that's why it always makes people so
chipper when spring has sprung!

<FACE_TORCU><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
So it's raining, is it? That's good news for the
plants. They need this moisture.
<PAGE>
It's thanks to the rain that they're able to live,
grow and thrive...
<PAGE>
And in turn, the rain is a blessing to us as well.

<FACE_TORCU><POS_RIGHT><FACE_ANGRY>
We should give thanks for such powerful
sunlight, as it helps the plants photosynthesize
and brings us greater bounty.
<PAGE>
<FACE_SAD>Though...I wouldn't mind if the sun were just a
tad weaker today...

<FACE_TORCU><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
The rain is a blessing in any season.
<PAGE>
<FACE_LAUGH>But it's especially welcome now! We could use a
bit of a cooling off...

<FACE_TORCU><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Do you know why leaves turn red in the
autumn?
<PAGE>
They're preparing. The sun gets weaker as the
season rolls on, and they know the fate that
awaits them...

<FACE_TORCU><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Autumn rain is cold and dismal. Reading indoors
is the best way to spend such days.

<FACE_TORCU><POS_RIGHT><FACE_SAD>
Why is the sun so much brighter when it reflects
off of snow? What is it that makes it sear into
one's eyes so?

<FACE_TORCU><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Snow blankets the earth and creates a veil of
silence, which makes studying immeasurably
easier...and more pleasant, as well!

<FACE_TORCU><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
What is it that causes typhoons?
<PAGE>
<FACE_SAD>I suppose that's something I'll have to ponder
another time. For now, you should go!

<FACE_TORCU><POS_RIGHT><FACE_SAD>
I can't believe you're going out in this weather...
I admire you for your hard work, but you mustn't
push yourself or you'll get sick.

<FACE_TORCU><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Dessie is not here right now. She was
summoned to the celestial kingdom.

<FACE_TORCU><POS_RIGHT><FACE_ANGRY>
Dessie... Please come back home soon. I can't
focus on my studies with you gone...

<FACE_TORCU><POS_RIGHT><FACE_ANGRY>
Have you seen Dessie anywhere?
<PAGE>
She's been slacking off in her studies, if you can
believe it. And that will never do!

<FACE_TORCU><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Dessie is technically a goddess -- thus the
nickname. But she's not yet full-fledged, and
must study ever harder until she is!

<FACE_TORCU><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
I like this place. It's so quiet, I can really focus
on my reading.

<FACE_TORCU><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Bees have been forming a new hive around here
of late.
<PAGE>
I suspect they had one here before, but perhaps
it fell to the ground and they're now rebuilding
their glorious society from scratch.

<FACE_TORCU><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Insects tend to gather in the trees around here.
And that includes rare species native only to this
area, as I understand it.

<FACE_TORCU><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
The summer heat may just be beat if we can dip
our feet in this spring. How neat!

<FACE_TORCU><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
There sure are a lot of mushrooms around here.
Maybe the spring increases the humidity in this
area just enough to help them thrive.

<FACE_TORCU><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
I love hearing the chirp of cicadas. Always the
first sign that summer is upon us!

<FACE_TORCU><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
I just love reading outside in this weather!
<PAGE>
The only thing I don't love is when leaves fall as
I'm turning the page and get stuck to the
paper...

<FACE_TORCU><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
There's nothing quite like a good snack to
recharge you during an intense study session, is
there?
<PAGE>
I think a little refresher is just what the doctor
ordered!
<PAGE>
...Hmm? What am I eating? Well, blueberries, of
course! Local ones. They're delicious!

<FACE_TORCU><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Have you heard of chattering cicadas? They're
one of the many cicada species you might
encounter, but they're quite rare.

<FACE_TORCU><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Snow, snow, go away!
<PAGE>
<FACE_SAD>It's hard for us to walk in the snow, you see.
Though I'm sure it's a lot easier for you... *sigh*

<FACE_TORCU><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Have you ever seen a snowflake? I mean, really
looked at one, up close and personal?
<PAGE>
How does nature produce something so perfect?
So...hexagonal? It boggles the mind!

<FACE_TORCU><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Winter is the time to get away from insects,
since the cold drives them into hibernation.

<FACE_TORCU><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
This way leads into town. You know, it might be
worthwhile to study the daily lives of these
people sometime...

<FACE_TORCU><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
There sure are a lot of flowers blooming around
here. I hear some of them can be used as herbs.

<FACE_TORCU><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Sometimes, you can see Black Stone Fireflies
flittering about. They're a rare species that come
out of hibernation only during spring.

<FACE_TORCU><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
I'll bet diving into the river for a swim would feel
absolutely wonderful right now.
<PAGE>
But if I did that, the books I have on my person
would get wet...so I really do need to restrain
myself.

<FACE_TORCU><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
You can catch fish in the river with a pole or
cultivate them in a hatchery.
<PAGE>
For efficiency's sake, I personally recommend a
hatchery. That leaves you more open to do other
things while you wait.

<FACE_TORCU><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Great orange tip butterflies are poisonous, you
know. So if you try catching any, please be very
careful.

<FACE_TORCU><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Time certainly does fly, doesn't it? It feels as
though summer's just begun, yet it's already the
autumn!

<FACE_TORCU><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Every now and again, I see black branches along
the roads.
<PAGE>
Do you know what type of tree they're from?

<FACE_TORCU><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
I haven't seen any rare insects for some time
now. Is this area inhospitable to bugs, perhaps?

<FACE_TORCU><POS_RIGHT><FACE_SAD>
Well, if the river's frozen, that means the current
temperature must be...
<PAGE>
*shiver* ...too cold.

<FACE_TORCU><POS_RIGHT><FACE_ANGRY>
Snowball fights, huh? One extra-frozen snowball
to the head, and suddenly you'll forget how to
do basic math...

<FACE_TORCU><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Insects have the most fascinating ecosystem,
don't they? I really need to study them further...

<FACE_TORCU><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
They say fresh spring tea keeps you healthy for
the entire year.
<PAGE>
Sounds like pure fiction to me. My guess is, it's
just so delicious that people invented new
excuses to keep making it!

<FACE_TORCU><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
A strange, hollow tree called "bamboo" was
described in a book I read the other day.
<PAGE>
Supposedly, it has an absolutely lovely smell.
Can such a strange, delightful-sounding tree
truly exist?

<FACE_TORCU><POS_RIGHT><FACE_LAUGH>
There are certainly a lot of rare insects, but the
rarest species of them all is the Alpine Black
Swallowtail, without a doubt.
<PAGE>
If you catch one, please do show it to me!

<FACE_TORCU><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Tea leaves harvested in summer are, of course,
summer tea leaves. By definition!
<PAGE>
Summer tea leaves are regarded quite highly, but
each season has its own flavor! Except winter,
sadly...

<FACE_TORCU><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Fruit is generally sweet, but I feel that summer
fruit is the sweetest of them all.

<FACE_TORCU><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Many rare insects won't come out in bad
weather.
<PAGE>
Frogs, on the other hand, come out only on
rainy days.

<FACE_TORCU><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Ah, autumn tea leaves abound!
<PAGE>
Autumn tea is naturally matured and has a rich
flavor you just don't get from spring tea. I simply
love it!

<FACE_TORCU><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Hey, <MYNAME>, have you heard of chili
pepper?
<PAGE>
I was reading about it. It's a spicy, exotic
seasoning from foreign lands. I told Gusto about
it and he got rather excited!

<FACE_TORCU><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Insects don't all operate on the same schedule.
Some species are active during the day, while
others come out only at night.
<PAGE>
If you can't find the bug you're looking for, you
might just need to try again at another time of
day!

<FACE_TORCU><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
You can't harvest tea leaves during winter, can
you? I'd love to try a winter tea, but I guess it
just was not to be. Oh, woe, oh, woe is me!

<FACE_TORCU><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Have you heard of sugar cane? I hear it can be
processed into a magical, delicious seasoning
the locals simply call "sugar."

<FACE_TORCU><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
It's a bit too cold for insects, I think.

<FACE_TORCU><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
There are a lot of beautiful flowers here. If only
there were no bees, I could sit on the grass and
read...

<FACE_TORCU><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Do you know how to improve the quality of
honey?
<PAGE>
Bees like the smell of flowers, so if you spray
perfume over their habitats, they'll work hard and
produce better honey.

<FACE_TORCU><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
How is it that bees can always keep their
distance from one other while flying?
<PAGE>
You'd think they'd be constantly bumping into
one another. It's like they KNOW. Is this what
you'd call a "hive mind"...?

<FACE_TORCU><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
When you think of summer flowers, what's the
first thing that pops into your mind?
Sunflowers, undoubtedly!
<PAGE>
I love how dignified they look, always standing
at attention and facing the sun.

<FACE_TORCU><POS_RIGHT><FACE_LAUGH>
Mmmm, I just love the smell of flowers. Mix
these together and you'll make a wonderful
perfume!

<FACE_TORCU><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
I sometimes see evening cicadas around here.
Are they looking for food, perhaps?

<FACE_TORCU><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
In the language of flowers, the hilton daisy
symbolizes "patience" and "hope."
<PAGE>
If I were to give one to Dessie, do you think
she'd get the wrong idea?

<FACE_TORCU><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Supposedly, the right perfume to use for
invigorating bees depends entirely on the species
of bee in question.
<PAGE>
...Not surprising, I suppose. Favorite foods differ
from person to person amongst us as well, after
all.

<FACE_TORCU><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
<MYNAME>, do you know the difference
between Red-Veined Darters and Wide-Bellied
Skimmers?
<PAGE>
As their name implies, Wide-Bellied Skimmers
have bigger stomachs than Red-Veined Darters.

<FACE_TORCU><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
In the language of flowers, the gentian
symbolizes "precision" and "justice."
<PAGE>
As one of Dessie's supporters, those are both
qualities I value highly.

<FACE_TORCU><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
I've been fascinated with a certain blue flower
known as the "blue rose."
<PAGE>
They say there are red and pink roses, too,
but...can this world truly be so blessed?

<FACE_TORCU><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Since bees can't come out during winter, I
guess honey isn't something you can harvest till
spring, is it?

<FACE_TORCU><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Root vegetables are vegetables where people
tend to eat the roots rather than the flowers or
leaves.
<PAGE>
Turnips and potatoes would be the current in-
season root vegetables, if I'm not mistaken.

<FACE_TORCU><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Some people say the smell of chamomile bears
a striking resemblance to that of an apple. I tend
to agree, myself.

<FACE_TORCU><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Butterflies are beautiful creatures, but before
they become adults, they look kind of
gruesome...
<PAGE>
Pepita would pass out if she saw one, for sure.

<FACE_TORCU><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Oh, <MYNAME>, I bet I know something you
don't!
<PAGE>
It's about pumpkins. Did you know they're
actually a leafy vegetable? They may not look
it...but they are!

<FACE_TORCU><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
It's difficult to tell if something is a root
vegetable or not just by looking, isn't it?
<PAGE>
Onions are a good example. Did you know
they're a root vegetable?

<FACE_TORCU><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Insects? Oh, I love them. Only the rare ones,
though!

<FACE_TORCU><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
In the autumn, it's rather easy to grow yams and
carrots, isn't it?
<PAGE>
Pepita's always working with yams around this
time of year, since she loves sweet things so
much.
<PAGE>
I get that they're good for you, but...not that
many at once!

<FACE_TORCU><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
I sprinkle some rosemary on my desk whenever I
study.
<PAGE>
I always feel like I can concentrate on my
studies a little harder when I smell that delightful
fragrance.

<FACE_TORCU><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Have you ever seen Brown Crickets? I hear
they're perfectly visible even in the dead of night!

<FACE_TORCU><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
As far as wintry root vegetables go, there's
nothing quite as iconic as the radish...

<FACE_TORCU><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
This area is so huge and so very nice. It's almost
too big, though. It puts me on edge...

<FACE_TORCU><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
<MYNAME>, have you ever seen a honeybee
hive? Each hole is a perfect hexagon.
<PAGE>
When spring comes, I should resume my studies
and see if I can determine the source of the
honeybees' geometrical prowess...

<FACE_TORCU><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
You don't need to water crops in paddies, you
know...not that that's a mistake you were likely
to make!

<FACE_TORCU><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Did you know you can make flour from wheat?
<PAGE>
Flour can be used in all manner of food, so I'd
personally recommend always having some
wheat at your disposal.

<FACE_TORCU><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
People tend to think of cicadas as summer
insects, but they sometimes appear in spring as
well.
<PAGE>
Though it's not till summer that they start to cry
with all their might!

<FACE_TORCU><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
This place is perfect for rice paddies, isn't it? It's
even got a river close by!

<FACE_TORCU><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
I found an old coin at the bottom of the river the
other day.
<PAGE>
I wonder where it came from...and what secrets
it may have borne witness to in its heyday...

<FACE_TORCU><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
I read that the reason fireflies light up is to
attract mates.
<PAGE>
Female fireflies are most attracted to males with
a healthy glow. It's kind of romantic, really!

<FACE_TORCU><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Do you like fishing?
<PAGE>
Depending on the time of year and the place,
you can catch all different kinds of fish. Best to
see what time and location work best for you!

<FACE_TORCU><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
You can generally harvest paddy crops any time
you'd like, but rice is different. Rice season is in
the autumn.

<FACE_TORCU><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
There are barely any rare insects around these
parts. Maybe it's because we're so close to
town...

<FACE_TORCU><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Don't the fish swimming around in the river look
cold to you?
<PAGE>
I hear they don't feel the temperature at all,
though. Isn't that kind of astonishing?

<FACE_TORCU><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Paddy crops consist of wasabi, lotus roots and
so forth.
<PAGE>
...I don't know much about wasabi, but I
wouldn't recommend growing lotus roots.
<PAGE>
Not unless you really, really like them. And even
then...I highly recommend you keep your
distance.

<FACE_TORCU><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
It's certainly brisk outside, isn't it? It's no wonder
all the insects hibernate for the winter.

<FACE_TORCU><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Anyone can be a teacher and anyone a student,
even if only for a single moment.
<PAGE>
I recommend taking the time to speak with as
many people as you can, since you never know
when one of those roles will be awaiting you.

<FACE_TORCU><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
I've been tasked to help Dessie with her studies.

<FACE_TORCU><POS_RIGHT><FACE_LAUGH>
<BLUE><ITEMNAME0></BLUE>!
<PAGE>
What? Is this for me?! It's such a rare dish... I-I
don't know what to say!
<PAGE>
<FACE_NORMAL>...Ahem, I'm sorry to have gotten so excited
there. You're an exceptionally nice person. Thank
you very much, <MYNAME>.

<FACE_TORCU><POS_RIGHT><FACE_LAUGH>
Oh! Is that...for me?!
<PAGE>
Ahem. Um... I quite like it. Thank you so very
much!

<FACE_TORCU><POS_RIGHT><FACE_LAUGH>
Oh, is this for me?
<PAGE>
How lovely! Thank you very much.

<FACE_TORCU><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Oh, a present...for me?
<PAGE>
Thank you very much, <MYNAME>.

<FACE_TORCU><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Huh... You, uh, realize I'm not the biggest fan
of...
<PAGE>
...No, never mind. I'll take it. Thanks.

<FACE_TORCU><POS_RIGHT><FACE_SAD>
Hmmm. I'll accept this.
<PAGE>
...But please try to remember in the future that
I...really can't stand these. If you would.

<FACE_TORCU><POS_RIGHT><FACE_ANGRY>
Oh, dear... <BLUE><ITEMNAME0></BLUE>...
<PAGE>
I'm really curious what in the world the person
who first came up with this was thinking.
<PAGE>
Lotus roots themselves have a disgusting
texture, so why would anyone make it worse by
grating it?!
<PAGE>
Well, that's neither here nor there. You brought it
to me as a gift, and so I'll accept. It's the
thought that counts, after all!

<FACE_TORCU><POS_RIGHT><FACE_LAUGH>
Ooh, it's glowing!
<PAGE>
Hmm? It's for me? How kind!
<PAGE>
I wonder what it tastes like... I am utterly
captivated right now!

<FACE_TORCU><POS_RIGHT><FACE_LAUGH>
Ooh, it's glowing!
<PAGE>
Hmm? It's for me? How kind!
<PAGE>
I'll have to find out what it tastes like.

<FACE_TORCU><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Ooh, it's glowing!
<PAGE>
Hmm? It's for me? Thank you very much.

<FACE_TORCU><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Ugh, this is...for me, huh?
<PAGE>
Well, it is rare, so...okay. I'll accept it. Thanks.

<FACE_TORCU><POS_RIGHT><FACE_SAD>
Ugh, this is...for me, huh?
<PAGE>
Well, it is rare, so...okay. I'll accept it. Thanks.

<FACE_TORCU><POS_RIGHT><FACE_SAD>
Ugh, this is...for me, huh?
<PAGE>
Well, it is rare, so...okay. I'll accept it. Thanks.

<FACE_TORCU><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Huh? Didn't you just give me a present?
<PAGE>
I can't accept this many presents in one day, I'm
afraid.
<PAGE>
But I do appreciate the thought. Thank you,
<MYNAME>.

<FACE_TORCU><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Why, hello, little bunny!

<FACE_TORCU><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Well, long time no see! How have you been?

<FACE_TORCU><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Thank you, as always, for giving us a ride, my
dear ermine.

<FACE_TORCU><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Oh, I believe we haven't met before. Or...we
have? How embarrassing. Please, do forgive my
forgetful mind!

<FACE_TORCU><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Hmm? Is that a present for me?
<PAGE>
...Come to think of it, there's a Flower Fair today,
isn't there?
<PAGE>
Of course! I knew it! ...I have no idea what it
entails, however.
<PAGE>
But I'll accept your present, either way. Thank
you.

<FACE_TORCU><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
A blue feather... Are you planning to give that to
someone?
<PAGE>
I read about it in a book once. You give it to the
person you want to marry, right?
<PAGE>
I wish we Nature Sprites had such a beautiful
tradition...

<FACE_TORCU><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Oh, is that ring a gift for someone special?
<PAGE>
The tradition of presenting a ring to someone
you love has been around since ancient times...
<PAGE>
Not that you're looking for a history lesson right
now, though! So how about I just wish you
luck, <MYNAME>?

<FACE_TORCU><POS_RIGHT><FACE_LAUGH>
Oh, that's such a nice ribbon on that present! I
love the color.
<PAGE>
Patterns that are elegant, but not flashy... Those
are my game.

<FACE_TORCU><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
My, what a nicely-wrapped present!

<FACE_TORCU><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Happy birthday, <MYNAME>.
<PAGE>
This is a present from me. But don't expect too
much.

<FACE_TORCU><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Happy birthday, <MYNAME>.
<PAGE>
I hope this year will be kind to you, and satisfy
all your curiosities about life!

<FACE_TORCU><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Well, long time no see, <MYNAME>!
<PAGE>
...What? Of course I remember you! I have a
mind like a steel trap, I do...

<FACE_TORCU><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
*yawn* I should go to sleep soon. Early to bed
and early to rise makes a Nature Sprite sprightly
and mighty, so...time for goodbyes!
